The internal link screen is currently broken. It displays an (very) incomplete
Site tree and there is the following java script error (maybe the two are
related). I tested this on the zones server using TinyMCE:


AREA_BASE_PATH is not defined
loadInitialTree("authoring", "/concepts")navtree.js (line 154)
buildTree()
creator: ragaller@apache.org

text:
Doesn't work in FCKeditor either. All three are identical, so there is code
duplication that can be removed once the issue is fixed.

The javascript error does indicate the cause of the problem. The site tab is
generated by a jx. The insert link page is generated by matching the pattern
link-show in the editor's sitemap.xmap. Seems to me that this should be
converted to a usecase.

modules-core/sitemanagement/usecases/tab/sitetree.jx is the site tab, which does
work.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text: fixed for bxe, working on a generic fix for all editors.
creator: nettings@apache.org

text: Jörn, are you still working on this?
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
sorry for the delay, been busy with other things. it turned out to be really
difficult for me to do it in java :(
i decided to use the approach i used for tiny: create the usecase view with a
cocoon pipeline, which enables me to use all the input modules rather than
having to instantiate a zillion avalon components in the usecase handler. it's
not consistent with other usecases (which use jxtemplate), but it's the only
approach i'm capable of... will try to commit tonight or tomorrow after some
testing.
